abstracts: SPEED OF DARK tells the powerful story of an autistic young man working for a bioinformatics company, who is offered an experimental ‘cure’ for autism by the company he works for, but he’s not sure he wants to take it. Elizabeth was inspired to write SPEED OF DARK by her own autistic son, Michael, and the story won the Nebula Award for Best Novel in 2003, as well as being shortlisted for an Arthur C. Clarke award.
